text:
If an XML file that has a reference to another file is parsed using x:parse and 
passed to x:transform with a xsltSystemID attribute being passed a systemID , 
the systemID does not take effect.
The error:
==================================================================
javax.servlet.ServletException: 
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException: 
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException: 
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException: Had IO Exception with stylesheet 
file: xsl/Attribute.xsl

creator: prasad.subramanian@sun.com
bayern@essentially.net
text:
Fixed in CVS head.  As told to Prasad earlier:

Per spec, the 'xslt' attribute for <x:transform> shouldn't even accept an
object exported by <x:parse>, unless it's a String, Reader, or
javax.xml.transform.Source.  The only bug here is that the <x:transform>
tag should refuse the input, not that the xsltSystemId isn't applied.
Thus, it's just a validation error; it only affects error conditions.

(The RI just happened to accept this type by accident; it used a common,
reusable mechanism to acquire the Source and neglected to enforce this
constraint.)
